1.content: Before this can begin, let's get some things straight. Who are you reincarnated as?
1.title: Your character

111.content: You are Skullkit, a young tom with brown tabby fur and a white underbelly who lives in ShadowClan. His eyes are dark green and his fur is long. Skullkit has no sense of humor and acts so deadly serious that some cats wonder about him.
111.title: Skullkit

choices: Skullkit is stopped from killing Snowkit
Skullkit decides to leave Snowkit alone and hopes the kit has learned his lesson
1111.content:
Skullkit felt a chilling breeze whip by, ruffling his tabby fur. He yawned, before returning to glaring at the other kits. They were outside of the nursery and the queen Droughtclaw's kits Ripplekit, Snowkit, and Pinekit were romping on the dusty ground. Those idiots, Skullkit thought as the three made utter fools of themselves. How was he even grouped in the same rank as them? Sure, he was a kit, but at least he didn't think that the fresh-kill fell from the sky.

"Skullkit, come and join us," Ripplekit called. The little gray she-kit acted as the unofficial leader of the younger kits. Skullkit thought that Ripplekit was born thinking that she was the only one who is important in the Clan. Many a time, he had witnessed the kit deliberately disobey Coldstar.

The tom shook his head, eyes revealing great scorn that went unnoticed by the subjects of his disgust. "No," he said, uttering the one-word answer with a smooth, icy voice. "I have more important things to do than that pointless game of yours."

Snowkit, always loyal to his sister and with a thorn-sharp tongue, mewed, "And what things do you have to go do? Eat mouse bile?" Ripplekit and Pinekit burst into fits of laughter. Skullkit let a growl rise to his throat, deep and rumbling which was unnatural for such a kit. He couldn't stand then with their ever stupid thoughts and jibes. The tabby pounced onto Snowkit, pinning him down roughly. He ignored the wailing and yowling of the other two, telling him to get off their brother. That fluffball was going to pay!

The silver and white tom stared at Skullkit with wide fearful eyes. "Please, don't hurt me!" he pleaded.

"Why should I?" the brown and white tabby snarled. He lifted one paw, claws unsheathed, prepared to deal a blow to the helpless kit.
1111.title: A dark soul

choices: Skullkit's apprenticeship is set back also (you can set the moons for setback)
Skullkit is to attend to the elder (you can put for how many moons)
11112.content:
Skullkit's breath was stolen away when he was flung off Snowkit to the cold ground. Sharp pain jolted through him as he landed in an uncomfortable position that jarred his bones. Groaning, he glanced upwards to discover the trio's mother Droughtclaw standing above.

"How dare you attempt to harm my kits," the queen scolded furiously, her amber eyes glinting in fierce protection of her darling kits. Droughtclaw pinned the tabby kit down with her right forepaw. "How can you, a kit, bother threatening another's life!"

Skullkit glared at the she-cat, a challenge evident in his green eyes. "Because I could care less for Clanmates who are fools. Nobody should nurture their nature of pure cowardice." Once again, his actions and words revealed too much knowledge for one his age. As Droughtclaw gazed upon him, she wondered perhaps if this kit's spirit was immersed in shadow since birth. Then a voice, familiar to all Clan members, sounded from behind.

Coldstar stood there, her frosty blue eyes narrowed in thought. Her fur was a dark golden color with pitch black tabby stripes. "What do we have here, Droughtclaw?" she asked, her tone sharp like the slice that comes from a cold wind. In fact her warrior name was Coldwind due to this tone. "Will you mind explaining why you apparently are assaulting a kit?"

Droughtclaw narrowed her eyes, mirroring Coldstar's dark expression. "This kit is surely an agent of the Dark Forest! He tried to do away Snowkit."

"Yet you try to kill as he has done. I am disappointed in you," Coldstar replied. She turned a knowing look at Skullkit before returning her focus on Droughtclaw. "Due to your actions, your kits' apprenticeship will be placed further back by one moon. That is fit since you have been boasting of your kits being higher in rank sooner or later. As for you, Skullkit..."
11112.title: Skullkit is stopped from killing Snowkit

112.content: You are a short-furred black tom with glistening amber eyes that goes by the name of Adderpaw. Currently, he resides in RiverClan and is frowned upon for his dark ideas and dreams of bringing down all the enemy Clans with a flick of his tail. Adderpaw has an older brother, who is already a warrior.
112.title: Adderpaw

choices: Your sister arrives with help two minutes later.
Your sister is killed. You get revenge
You fight with all the might of Tigerclan!
113.content:
"Come on Tigerpaw, show me the hunting crouch!" Whined your annoying little sister. Shinekit, your sister, insisted on learning everything at the same rate as you. You had been in training for about four and a half moons while your sister was only three and a quarter moons old.
"No Shinekit, I have to go out on patrol with Fireheart."
"But you just got back from a patrol, why can't you show me?"
Grrrrrr.... you think to yourself.
"That was a hunting patrol, I have to go back out for a border patrol."
"Actually, I am relieving you of that, Tigerpaw." Said a familiar voice. Standing Directly behind you was your mentor, Fireheart. You growl inwardly. You dispised Fireheart with such a passion, that even he knew it.
"I think that you should go and have fun with her, she will be looked after when it is her time to become apprenticed. I'l make sure that she will be busy."
He looked directly at your sister when he said that last part.
"Oh, allright. I will teach you the hunting crouch, but only if you promise to leace me alone."
"Yes Tigerpaw." your sister said.
Looking back at Fireheart, "I still don't like you." You growl. Somehow, you hate him, but you have no idea why.
"May I ask why you hate me so much?" Fireheart asked kindly.
You reply burningly. "You can ask..." Then you walk off.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------


At the training hollow, you start to teach your sister, Shinekit how to properly stalk a mouse.
"You have to lean down and put your weight on your haunches. then walk slowly towards the mouse."

Then, while you were teaching her, you hear a rustling sound. You pause to smell the air. An enemy battle patrol!
"Shinekit, run as fast as you possibly can back to camp and warn them there is an enemy invasion."
without question, she ran back to camp. As soon as her tail disappeard into the undergrowth, You are pounced on by the patrol. You may not know many battle moves, but you still fight.
113.title: A sister: Ambush.

choices: Bloodlust must be fulfilled. (Kill the killer.)
1132.content:
After you were pounced on by the patrol and your sister was in the forest, you fought with everything you had.
Suddenly, you heard a terrible screech that you recognized as your sisters.
Oh no! You thought.
10 Secnonds later, you saw her body being carried by a shadowclan warrior.
"Hehe, Caught this one trying to go get help. That wouldn't be fair."
You stopped and looked at her.
"Y-You killed her!!!!!!" You shouted.
___________________________________
(Back at camp.)
Fireheart was in camp enjoying a vole when he heard a terrinle screech. That was followed by a ferocious yowl.
This made Fireheart pause from his lunch.
Suddnely, he looked towards the direction of the training hollow.
"Tigerpaw!"
He yowled in alarm.
He dropped hes vole and sprinted toward his apprentice.
"Hang on tigerpaw, i am on my way!"
_____________________________________
(Training hollow.)

"You killed her!!!!!!!!!!!!"
Something stirred in you. Some type of enourmous pain, rage, and the thirst to kill.
"Yeah, what you gonna do bout it? little paw." The killer taunted.
"Return the favor." You growled in a voice not your own.
You let out a battle cry and leaped onto hte killer.
You scratched him here, bit him there, kicked and clawed and you two were tumbling over and over and over. Each time blood was spilling from your wounds when he hit you. But failure was SO NOT an option now. Your body was numb with pain but you kept on fighting and fighting.
"For Shinekit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" You yowled.
_________________________________
(Fireheart is almost there.)
Fireheart felt as if his lungs would explode from being overworked. He hadn't rum like this in a while.
"Hole on! I'm comming for you!" He panted.
"Just a little more!"
___________________________
(Hollow. Fight for death continues.)
You both were panting when the killer made his move.
He jumped for you but you flipped a back flip and used your hind claws to scratch deep into his face.
"OOOOOOOOWWWWWWWWWWW!" He yelled.
You wanted to waste no time at all when he was laying there, blind, weak, helpless.
But should you kill him?
1132.title: REVENGE, is a dish best served cold.

choices: Fireheart takes Tigerpaw back to camp. (judge, jury, conviction)
Fireheart takes Tigerpaw back to camp (Warrior Ceremony for bravery. i will add)
11322.content:
as you stand there, with most of the patrol already either bleeding out slowly, or running the hell away to their mothers, you can't help but feel kind of sorry for what you did.
but then again, killers do not deserve mercy.
"Go ahead, little paw, kill me, i am already far too gone to live now. and i deserve to die."

Little did you know that Fireheart was behind you... but he kept silent, for now.



Then you made your decision:
Death!
You raised your paw, massive claws unsheathed, and dealt a srape across his throat.
blood instantly welled up from the fatal wound.
a minute later, he had stopped breathing.
Fireheart came from the shadows.


what happens now.
11322.title: Bloodlust must be fulfilled. (Kill the killer.)

choices: Tigerpaw has a mysterious StarClan sent dream
Fireheart has a mysterious StarClan sent dream from Spottedleaf (i will add.)
113222.content:
Fireheart crept up on Tigerpaw from the shadows, he had been watching with both interest and horror...

"Tigerpaw!" Shouted Fireheart, making the younger apprentice jump in fear and surprise.
It was then, Fireheart noticed, that there was an unfamiliar glint in his eyes.
Fireheart looked closer, his blood turned cold.

"Yes, little fire, it is i, Tigerstar, i have come back for my revenge, see how Vulnerable his life can be, i am his granfather, but now, i have returned, beware kittypet, you won't be deputy for long, and you will never be leader, i will make absolutely sure about that..."

There was a hostile, yet silky voice in the air that seemed to come from the shadows, whispering to Fireheart, making him rooted to the spot where he now stood in absolute fear. Fireheart knew that voice, it was his old nemises, Tigerstar...

"Y-Yes, Fireheart?" Tigerpaw said to Fireheart, who shook his head in denial, NO! i did not hear that, did i?

"Why did you kill him?" Fireheart demanded, yet some part of him knew....
His sister was murdered... Fireheart thought.

"He killed my Sister!!!!!!!" Shouted Tigerpaw. "I managed to not kill the other ones, but this one," Tigerpaw was seething with rage as he looked upon the warrior he killed in revenge. "he did NOT deserve to live! He killed my sister!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"
The young and deeply troubled apprentice said, tears and fury in his round eyes.

"You killed him in revenge for your lost sister, does that make you any better than he was in his life?" said a calm, familiar voice.

Fireheart turned around, Bluestar was comming from the camp, most of the warriors right behind her.
To her right, stood the unforgiving she-cat; Ligerstreak, and behind her, was her mate; Thornburrow.
to Bluestar's left, were two newly named warriors, two that Fireheart didn't like very much: Sandsnake, and her litter mate; Darkstripe.

(I don't own any of these characters, even though i am in the thrid book of the fourth series, i tend to forget names and random ones pop up, sorry...)

"Now, lookie at what we have here," cooed the mean she-cat Ligerstreak, egging Fireheart on, "A poor lost ShadowClan patrol slain by a mis-named Kittypet and his worthless apprentice!" that last voice came from one of Ligerstreak's partner in crime: Sandsnake, she spat the word 'kittypet' as if it were a deadly disease.

"Enough!, Ligerstreak, Sandsnake, go check the forest, make sure that no ShadowClan warriors are here. I do not need your help in the affairs of inward clan safety, that is my job, hence the title and name and nine lives that go with it."
The old Clan leader She-cat paused, waiting for the two troubling She-cats to scurry away, but Fireheart was NOT fooled by Bluestar's soft tone, he could tell, through experience, that the old She-cat was mad beyond beleif, as she had every right to be, there was a double murder in her clan territory.
he cringed a bit, but stood his ground.
"now, without another word from either of you, we will escort you back to camp."
Bluestar said to Fireheart and Tigerpaw, who followed without question.

The rode back to camp was a solemn one, when they arrived back into the hollow through the thorn bushes, they were met with curios eyes of other warriors.
Fireheart smelled their fear scent, they were expecting to fight off any threat of ShadowClan.
but eventually, they calmed down and Bluestar went up to her usual perch when she gave a speech.

"Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey join me beneath the High-Rock for a clan gathering!"
Bluestar's voice rang clear across the large clearing that Served as ThunderClan's camp.
Most of the warriors were there already, but the Medicine cat, Silverleaf, and her apprentice, who was blind, Joypaw, came out and sat together.
Ligerstreak and Sandsnake had returned, and then sat next to the Medicine cats, complaining in a whisper that they were always last for something...

"As you may already know," Shouted Bluestar over everyone, "Tigerpaw, Fireheart's apprentice, has killed a ShadowClan warrior and fended off their unjust raid."
She waited for everyone to settle down again and then spoke once more, power still in her voice.

"For that, we will hold a very much needed Warrior Ceremony." She paused, then looked at Fireheart and his apprentice, and spoke:
“Fireheart, Tigerpaw step forth.” She said.
Fireheart and Tigerpaw did as they were told.
But something was lurking in the shadows, it had eyes, and it was a massive tabby, barely visible, but without opening its massive jaws, it spoke, directly to Fireheart as so it seemed:
“Beware Kittypet! I will have my revenge through him!”
“Fireheart!” Bluestar’s meow jerked him back to reality.
“Yes, Bluestar?” Fireheart addressed the ThunderClan leader.
“Do you feel that Tigerpaw is worthy of Warriorship?”
“Yes, I do. He has trained hard and been through so much, I believe he deserves being a Warrior than most here do.” Fireheart replied truthfully.
A few murmurs of ‘favoritism’ and ‘dis-loyalty’ broke out, but were quickly silenced by a hard stare from Bluestar.
“I see.” The leader said. Then she addressed Tigerpaw:
Bluestar looked up at the Sky.
“StarClan, I address you as Bluestar, 32nd leader of ThunderClan, I call upon you to look down on this apprentice and accept him into your ranks, he will, as of tonight, become a full member of ThunderClan, may you see this and be pleased.” Bluestar recited the forest old ritual for a Warrior Ceremony.

“Tigerpaw, step forth below the High-Rock,” The apprentice did as he was told.
“You have trained hard in your youth, your apprentice-ship has taught you humbleness, loyalty and friendship, these are the traits of a Great leader, and they are also what define you, correct?”

“Yes Ma’am. They do.” Tigerpaw said, bowing his head in respect.
“Tigerpaw, do you swear to uphold and protect the rules of the Warrior Code and to defend your clan with loyalty and your absolute best effort even at the cost of your life?”
“I do, Bluestar.” Tigerpaw said, bowing his head once more.
“Then by the powers of StarClan, I name you Tigerclaw, in honor of your strength, loyalty, and Faith in the service of your clan. We welcomes you as a Full member of ThunderClan.”
There were shouts of support.
“Tigerclaw! Tigerclaw! Tigerclaw!”
the clan shouted over and over again.
“Now, according to tradition, The newly named Warrior; Tigerclaw, must sit a silent vigil and guard the camp for one full night while we sleep peacefully knowing we are safe in Tigerclaw’s watch. Welcome Tigerclaw.”

The meeting was adjourned and every one ate their fill, congratulated the new warrior, and went to their dens and were fast asleep…
113222.title: Shock, what was that?

choices: Tigerpaw had chased the Shadowclan patrol off.
Tigerpaw had killed the entire Shadowclan patrol.
1133.content:
"Heheh. brave little fella isn't he?" said a voice near Tigerpaw. "Too bad, really. He would've made a great warrior." A murmor of snickering and scornfull purrs wafted from nearby the source of the voice. It was definitely a full patrol.

Tigerpaw defiantly growled at the voice. how DARE they set foot on his territory, not to mention make a comment like that!

"If courage makes a warrior, then why are you hiding in the undergrowth, you coward!" he spat, fur puffed up in rage.

"Why you little..." Black fur streaked out of the ferns and lashed out claws at Tigerpaws face. For sopme reason or other, they missed. Tigerstar was startled for a moment before he realiuzsed he had dodged the swipe. It wasn't instinct however... it was something more, like his paws were being controlled by a great force, launching him out of the way from the attacking warrior.

"I may be little..." Tigerpaw said with a voice not quite his own. "but I can still claw you to shreds!"

His legs rippled with newfound strength as Tigerpaw launched himself forward at the attacker. The Smirk on his face soon disappeared as he bowled the bigger cat over, and tore at his exposed belly with sharp claws. He tried to push you off, but his efforts were fruitless. All resistence was futile.

"Aaaagh!" He screamed, "Get him off of me!"

Pawsteps thundered behind Tigerpaw, and more forms streaked towards him, ready to attack. Angrily, he gave one last swipe at the first cat, and turned to face the new opponents. Two she-cats and a tom were all hissing and spitting at him as the first attacker slunk away with his tail between his legs.

"Come on, Moonclaw! Defeated by an apprentice? You're pathetic!" teased one of the she-cats. "Lets show him what REAL Shadowclan can do, Pebbleeye!"

Pebbleeye, the other she-cat, nodded and leapt at Tigerpaw, but he was ready. He jumped upward, and as she landed, he fell on top of her, and bit fiercely at her neck. Grabbing a nearby tree with his hind claws, he swung around, pulling the larger cat by her neck fur and sending her flying into the undergrowth.

The first she-cat looked stunned, but only for a moment before she hissed and ran at him, claws glinting in the sunlight.

-------

"It was over here!" yelled Shinekit, full of fear for her older brother. A full patrol of Warriors followed her, rushing forth to face the enemy. They reached the hollow where Tigerpaw had been playing with Shinekit, and the whole patrol gasped at what they saw...
1133.title: For the clan!

11332.content:
Tigerpaw stood there, surrounded by the dead bodies of his opponents. He panted heavily. His adversaries had been bigger and more experienced probably than himself, but it had been quite clear to him that they didn't have the cunning that he had on his side. So now the apprentice just stared at motionless bodies, looked at their glazed eyes. Suddenly he heard a chorus of gasps.

Shinekit stood among a patrol of warriors, her eyes widened at the sight of the scene she had come upon. Tigerpaw noticed one of warriors try to cover his little sister's eyes with his tail, but paused before deciding not to. She had already seen and now it would be imprinted on her mind forever.

"What have you done?" Fireheart demanded in surprise. He had come along with the patrol to make sure that his apprentice was okay. And he had discovered this now.

Tigerpaw, at unease, licked one of his forepaws. "I defended my Clan," he said defensively. Those cats could have killed him had he not fought back. "They were a threat."

Fireheart's eyes burned angrily. "So you killed them! That is an outrage. You should've let the patrol do it or at least chase them off. Not to take their fate into your paws!" He lashed his tail. "Now what are we going to have to say to ShadowClan?"

Tigerpaw felt sickened by the deadly glares given by the warriors.

"Come on, we're going to Bluestar about this," Fireheart growled, moving him away toward the camp. He glanced over his shoulder at the patrol and Shinekit. "Go with us Shinekit. The patrol will dispose of the corpses."

-----
Tigerpaw stood trembling in front of Bluestar, his eyes downcast.

"Fireheart told me all about your story," the leader said. And knowing him, Tigerpaw thought, he most definitely overexaggerated it. "It was a ruthless thing to do Tigerpaw so your punishment is..."
11332.title: The tiger carries death on his stripes

12.content: Is there any siblings in the picture?
12.title: Bluestar

121.content: You are Brookkit, a young, long-furred, blue she-cat, who is very sweet and kind. Her eyes are jade green and she lives in ThunderClan. Brookkit can also be very fierce when she wants to. She loves her Clan with all her heart.
121.title: Brookkit

choices: A fox comes out of the bushes
One of her clanmates find her
She unknowingly passed into different clan territory and is caught by a patrol
1211.content: Brookkit felt the sun shine through the clouds and warm her soft blue pelt. She shouldn't be out here, she had been sternly told not to, but the she-kit had done it anyways in hopes of finding adventure. Brookkit didn't believe in those stories about owls carrying away the kits who strayed away from their mothers. To her it was a bunch of useless leaves that had fallen onto the ground during leaf-fall. Standing outside of the camp, the tiny felt that the world was hers explore, to make more beautiful. She was so caught up in the world outside that she had been only told about, that she didn't notice the rustle of the bushes...
1211.title: The kit who wandered away

choices: "Heatherstar is going to lose his last life!"
"Moonpaw has received a message from StarClan! It will be the death of us all!"
12111.content:
Brookkit turned around suddenly and almost collided with a furry, ruddy face. Fox! She jumped up and made for a tree as fast as her kit legs could carry her. Surely she couldn't' tout run a fox? A battle cry sounded behind her. She darted up the tree scrabbling for the nearest branch. Only then did she turn around to face the battle scene in the clearing. Thrushpelt, a warrior of her clan had tackled the fox. The fox was small, it was only a juvenile, and Thrushpaw had managed to pin it to the ground. He gave it a warning bite on the ear and let it go. Brookkit scurried down the tree, a scowl on her face. "Why did you let it go!" She yowled. "You could have killed it!"
"It was only a kit' and-"
"So you took pity on it?" Brookkit interrupted
"No. It Was only a kit, and it's mother should be nearby. Do you want a full grown fox to attack me? It won't be back for another moon. I'll warn Heatherstar and the rest of the camp. We'll keep an eye out for them." Thrushpelt spun around and stalked back to camp. Brookkit waited for a second, then followed a few tail-lengths behind. When she approached the bracken wall that surrounded the camp she began to hear a commotion. When she crawled through the tunnel into camp she could see cats running around everywhere. She ran up to her mother, Mossfoot, and asked her what was going on. Her answer seemed to coma all at once.
"..."
12111.title: A fox comes out of the bushes

choices: But, no. I will not come.
So yes, I will come. For now.
12112.content:
Thrushpelt emerged from the bushes shaking the dew off his fur. He stopped in his tracks when he saw Brookkit. "What are you doing here? You aren't supposed to be out here! Your a kit! Go back to camp. Your mother's looking for you." Thrushpelt didn't seem mad at her, instead he sounded like he was afraid for her. She remembered a story she heard about his sister walking out of camp and not coming back. They had looked everywhere for her, but she was not found. They suspected that she had fallen into the stream at the edge of their territory.
Brookkit cocked her head to one side and smoothly delivered her answer. "I respect your authority, Thrushpelt, ...
12112.title: One of her clanmates find her

122.content:
Frills is a young white tabby she-cat with soulful blue eyes. She is a kittypet who is terribly abused by her housefolk and wishes for a way to escape. The forest has called for her since she was old enough to open her eyes. Frills feels that she is part of something important. Problem is that she can't do anything as she is closed off from the outside world.

Her brother is a silver tom named Evans.
122.title: Frills

123.content: Skypaw is a light gray apprentice of seven moons. She has light green eyes and light flecks on her pelt. Her sister is Petalpelt, a warrior of the same age. She has amber eyes and has a whit pelt with ginger tinting. The two are part of Wind Clan. Skypaw is neglected by her clan, except for her sister who would do anything for her.
123.title: Skypaw

1231.content: Bluestar padded to a pool full of water. Her eyes met Oakheart's, and he nodded. "We are here to decide which queen Bluestar will be reincarnated to, and if at all if she will. Bluestar, you may speak." Oakheart dipped his head and stepped back. Bluestar stepped up to speak. "I thank you all, who have decided I deserve to be part of ThunderClan again" "You deserve it, Bluestar. You have lived a worthy life" That was Lionheart. "And I wish to be in Cinderheart's litter", declared Bluestar. Murmers of amusement passed along the crowds.
1231.title: Bluestar's Reincarnation

131.content: Being the only kit of Willowlight and Reedtail is very dull to the RiverClan apprentice, Nettlepaw. His life is very average. His parents are as normal as can be. What was more depressing was that he is mute. Nettlepaw's thoughts can only stay in his mind and not be heard by anyone else. Everyone assumes they know what Nettlepaw would say and constantly are his voice for him. The apprentice hates that. Nobody truly knows him. And he spends his days dreaming, wanting to have a new life.
131.title: Nettlepaw

132.content: Hawkpaw is one of the few apprentices that are currently in ShadowClan. The black and brown tabby tom has been an apprentice for very long. His younger brother is already a warrior and goes by the name of Owlear. Hawkpaw is quite envious of his brother and constantly watches him with the blue orbs that are his eyes, wondering why he isn't a warrior. Hawkpaw can't help but feel that his Clanmates are deathly afraid of him yet he doesn't know why.
132.title: Hawkpaw

133.content: Rainpaw is a strong black tabby tom with green eyes in ThunderClan who has just started his apprenticeship a moon ago. He is popular but he often has odd dreams of the destruction of his Clan by his own paw. Rainpaw doesn't know to think of them and constantly tries to push these dreams out of his head. He does not want to think of them, because he believes he would never destroy his Clan. Rainpaw tends to look after his younger sister Lotuskit with extreme intensity.
133.title: Rainpaw

14.content: Okay, does your character have brothers or sisters?
14.title: Siblings

141.content: Pridepaw is a young tom, newly made an apprentice. He is a dark golden tabby with the brightest silver eyes seen who resides in ThunderClan. He feels slightly left out in the Clan because he is the only cat who hasn't had at least one sibling and tends to think more creatively.
141.title: Pridepaw

142.content: Marko is a quick-thinking rogue who lives with his brother, Roc, at the edge of WindClan territory. He is characterized by his amber eyes with emerald specks, rough pale brown fur, and quiet voice. Over the moons, he has started to drift away from reality. Marko is struck with dreams. Always in these dreams he is fighting beside a regal golden tomcat. The tom appears to be telling him something, but he doesn't know what.
142.title: Marko

143.content: A humorless and vicious tomcat, Darkflight is not a warrior that should be crossed. A proud member of WindClan, the black-furred tomcat is fanatically loyal to his Clan and his little sister, and is almost completely unlike his past self. However, due to an ominous prophecy, he may need all of his former life's knowledge.
143.title: Darkflight

15.content: You are a dark brown tom with glowing yellow eyes. You are called Bloodkit and you belong to Shadowclan. You are interested in battle early on in life and want to be the strongest cat there could possibly be.
15.title: Darkstripe

choices: Bloodkit decides that he doesn't care what his mother thinks and fights
Bloodkit hesitantly returns to the nursery
151.content:
Bloodkit growled in annoyance as his mother, Falconfeather, groomed his fur. He was supposed to eventually be the greatest warrior alive and he still was getting his fur cleaned by his mother. What's with her? It's not like it's my apprentice ceremony yet! The dark tom drew away with a disgusted grunt from Falconfeather's grooming tongue,

"I'm old enough to groom myself now, Mom," Bloodkit complained. "Besides if you keep on grooming me, it will probably go on forever. What if you still groom me when I'm a well-seasoned warrior?"

His mother gave a throaty purr. "You are so persistant, aren't you? Stop being ashamed." With one gray tabby paw, Falconfeather drew Bloodkit back to her and continued to groom his pelt.

Bloodkit sighed and closed his yellow eyes. One day, I'll be great. My enemies will fear me and flee as I approach them. Then, I won't be as weak and outspoken as I am. I will not be thought as foolish anymore at that time. The Clan will only think of me as brave and strong. In his mind, Bloodkit pictured the great battles he would have. The cats that he would slay in the name of ShadowClan. He imagined his name among the legends told by the elders, tales of him told to the kits later on. All of this could be his. The problem was that he wasn't a warrior or an apprentice yet so by standards he wasn't fit to train to battle and hunt. Oh, how he wanted to have his first battle so bad.

Then, there was a racket outside of the nursery. With a thought of curiosity, Bloodkit squirmed from Falconfeather's grip and made a small leap outside. The camp was immense to him, not that he really cared right now. All he wanted was to know what was going on right then. He saw his Blackflame, his father, wrestling with an unfamiliar cat and wondered if he should ask to join what he thought was a play-fight. That was when he noticed the blood from the wounds in Blackflame.

Bloodkit knew now that they were under attack, but by who he didn't really know. Possibly rogues were the attackers. Then a surge of happiness raced through Bloodkit. Now I could prove I am worthy to be an apprentice by fighting, he thought. But what about his mother? She wouldn't be pleased if he got himself killed in this fight. What could he do?
151.title: A Kit With A Lust For Battle

1511.content:
Bloodkit decides that in the end his mother would be proud if he helped defeat the attackers. Bloodkit springs on a small ginger she cat about 7 moods old. He lunges at her and she spins around and dodges his attack. She springs on him and digs her claws in to his fur. He lets out a howl of pain but refuses to be beat.
So does Bloodkit end up in the medicine den or does he triumph against his enemy?
1511.title: Bloodkit decides that he doesn't care what ...

choices: "...you'll never be a warrior. Your entire left foreleg is twisted beyond repair
15111.content:
Bloodkit's face was shoved into the grass by the opposing she-cat. The apprentice raked her claws over one of the kit's ears. Bloodkit whimpered. She then proceeded to viciously bat him. Bloodkit was ruthlessly flung backwards into a large rock. Its jagged edges cut his flank. Rusty red spots took over the majority of his vision.

The she-cat crooned with a mocking tone,"Aww, the poor little kit decides to play with the big bad apprentice." She shoved her face up to his, just barely brushing his face with her whiskers. "Honestly, I'm flattered. I haven't delivered a beating to one as stupid as you in a long while." The rancid smell of her breath gave Bloodkit a sense of nausea. Bloodkit's eyes were half-closed, weakness overwhelming his small body. His tiny mouth quivered in a fruitless attempt to try a snarl of defiance. He had seen his father demonstrate it a couple of times and he felt that it would give him confidence. Yet all hope faded for him when no sound came past his throat.

"RiverClan retreat!" came a distant cry that faintly pierced the sound of Bloodkit's pounding heart.

The she-cat pulled her lips back into a sharp-toothed grin. Bloodkit couldn't help but widen his eyes a bit. A shiver ran down his back, rattling his bones. "See ya, wouldn't want to be ya." Then everything faded to black and Bloodkit couldn't help but silently embrace it.

---------------------

When Bloodkit awoke, he saw the walls of the medicine den. A sharp jolt of pain racked him as he cranes his neck to see Rainshadow, the medicine cat. She blinked her light blue eyes at him.

"Don't move, little one. You were battered badly in that battle, not that you should have been involved in the first place. Hopefully, I don't burden you more by saying..."
15111.title: Medicine Den

choices: Bloodkit goes out to see his father's body
Bloodkit attempts to leave the camp in a fit of grief
151112.content:
"...your father Blackflame was killed."

Bloodkit knew that Rainshadow was known in the Clan for her lack of sympathy. She always was the one to be the bearer of bad news to some cat when their dear ones were killed. The small kit had always looked on curiously as Rainshadow delivered the news with a flat tone. He'd never thought anything truly of it and even supported her actions. After all, warriors needed to move on and continue to serve the Clan, not dwell on the past. However, Bloodkit felt otherwise now.

Stones weighed down his stomach. The air now felt toxic, searing giant holes into his throat. With just a couple of small words, Bloodkit's own world seemed to drop far beyond his reach.

"Your father died from severe wounds to the neck and throat. He served our Clan faithfully."

Bloodkit stared down at the ground, wishing for it to open up beneath him, swallow him whole. I don't need to hear how great he was. I just- I just want him back. Now, he thought. I'm betting he's right outside, waiting for me to walk out. Then, he'll jump out and say, "Haha, got you again!" Like always.

"Bloodkit? Bloodkit? You're all right, aren't you?"

I need to do something. I must.

He breathed in deeply, and tried to restore calmness within himself. The pain of his body was deep, seemingly neverending, but he had to move. Bloodkit forced himself up and limped out of the den, panting.

"Bloodkit!"
151112.title: "...your father Blackflame was killed."

info.brief_description: You are a cat from the Dark Forest or StarClan who has been reincarnated.
info.description:
There are six cats to choose to be. They are Bluestar, Tigerstar, Brokentail, Lionheart, or Darkstripe.

Note: The user Faith has requested to solely write the path of Tigerstar, as most no one else contributes to it.
